All data.Name: Episode 1: Kevin Rose
Description: I consider Kevin Rose one of the best  stock pickers  in the early startup game
and he can predict even non-tech trends with stunning accuracy. Kevin is a tech entrepreneur who co-founded Digg
Revision3 (sold to Discovery Channel)
Pownce
and Milk (sold to Google). Since 2012
he is a venture partner at Google Ventures. He's also a hilarious dude
and this episode involves heavy drinking.
All data.Titles of Books Referenced in Show Notes: Venture Deals: Be Smarter Than Your Lawyer and Venture Capitalist

All data.Name: Episode 2: Joshua Waitzkin
Description: Josh Waitzkin was the basis for the book and movie  Searching for Bobby Fischer.  Considered a chess prodigy
he has learning strategies that can be applied to anything
including his other loves of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu (he's a black belt under Marcelo Garcia) and Tai Chi Push Hands (he's a world champion). Now
he spends his time coaching the world's top performers
whether Mark Messier
Cal Ripken Jr.
or hedgefund managers. This episode is DEEP in the best way possible. And for a change from Episode 1
I'm totally sober.
All data.Titles of Books Referenced in Show Notes: The Art of Learning: An Inner Journey to Optimal Performance

All data.Name: Episode 4: Ryan Holiday
Description: This episode features Ryan Holiday
who became Director of Marketing at American Apparel at age 21 (!).Since dropping out of college at 19 to apprentice under the strategist Robert Greene
Ryan has advised many bestselling authors (including yours truly) and multi-platinum musicians. He is master of the media
and he knows how to both build massive buzz and respond to unexpected crises. I hired him to help with the launches of The 4-Hour Body and The 4-Hour Chef
and his unorthodox approaches always impress. He takes the paths less traveled.In this episode
we discuss dozens of topics
including the real-world strategies he uses to thrive (not just survive) when the world is exploding around him.Enjoy!
All data.Titles of Books Referenced in Show Notes: The Obstacle Is the Way: The Timeless Art of Turning Trials into Triumph

All data.Name: Episode 5: Jason Silva
Description: Jason Silva (@JasonSilva) is a filmmaker and has been called the  Timothy Leary of the viral video age  by The Atlantic. He is also host of Brain Games on National Geographic Channel. The show set a record as the highest-rated series launch in Nat Geo's history
with an average of 1.5 million viewers for the first two episodes.In this episode
we discuss his career
his skills
TV
what it means to be a  performance philosopher,  and much
much more. Enjoy!

Name: Episode 7: Stephen Dubner
co-author of Freakonomics
Description: Stephen J. Dubner is an award-winning author
journalist
and radio and TV personality. He is best-known for writing
along with the economist Steven D. Levitt
Freakonomics (2005)
SuperFreakonomics (2009)
and Think Like a Freak (2014)
which have sold more than 5 million copies in 35 languages.In this podcast
we discuss dozens of topics
including: his writing process
religion
how to  think like freak,  parenting
favorite documentaries
and much
much more.Show notes and more at http://www.fourhourblog.com Just search  Dubner Enjoy!
All data.Titles of Books Referenced in Show Notes: Think Like a Freak: The Authors of Freakonomics Offer to Retrain Your Brain

Name: Episode 8: Chase Jarvis
Master Photographer
Description: Chase Jarvis is a master photographer and the CEO of CreativeLIVE.com. He is the youngest person ever to be named a Hasselblad Master
Nikon Master
and ASMP Master.Since opening his own studio
Chase has photographed for Nike
Apple
Columbia Sportswear
REI
Honda
Subaru
Polaroid
Lady Gaga
Red Bull
and many more. He is known for a hyper-kinetic style and an emphasis on sports
lifestyle
and portraiture. CreativeLIVE.com
of which he's CEO
is an online learning platform that broadcasts live

high-definition classes to more than 2M students in 200 countries. All classes are free to watch while live and can be purchased for repeated viewing. They are amazing. Teachers include Pulitzer Prize winners
business luminaries
and beyond.In this conversation
we explore his personal story
the most important choices he's made
common mistakes of  creative  professionals (or people in general)
and how he reached the pinnacle of his industry. His lessons learned can be applied almost anywhere.For full show notes
please visit www.fourhourblog.com. Say hello to Chase on Twitter at @chasejarvis. Enjoy!

co-writer/producer of Rounders
Ocean's Thirteen
The Illusionist
etc.
Description: Brian Koppelman is a screenwriter
novelist
director
and producer. He is best known as the co-writer of Ocean's Thirteen and Rounders
as well as a producer of The Illusionist and The Lucky Ones. He has directed films including Solitary Man (Michael Douglas).In his episode
we discuss how he got started
how he handles rejection
his big breaks
his creative process
and much
much more.Show notes and links at http://www.fourhourblog.com Just search  Koppelman Brian can be found on Twitter at @briankoppelman. Enjoy!- Tim

Name: Ep. 12: Dr. Rhonda Patrick on Life Extension
Performance
and More
Description: My guest this episode is Rhonda Perciavalle Patrick
Ph.D.
who works with Dr. Bruce Ames
the 23rd most-cited scientist across ALL fields between 1973 and 1984 (!).Dr. Patrick also conducts clinical trials
performed aging research at Salk Institute for Biological Studies
and did graduate research at St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital
where she focused on cancer
mitochondrial metabolism
and apoptosis. Whether you want to extend life
buy a stem-cell  insurance policy,  or guard against cancer and premature death
she will have a surprise insight for you.Find her on Twitter at @foundmyfitness.Enjoy!Tim

she will have a surprise insight for you.Find her on Twitter at @foundmyfitness.Enjoy!Tim

Name: ExplicitEp. 16 - Joe De Sena on Grit
Endurance
and Building Empires
Description: Joe De Sena is the co-founder of The Death Race
Spartan Race (1M+ competitors)
and more. Among other things
he has personally completed the famously grueling Iditarod dogsledding race...by FOOT. What about the Badwater Ultramarathon
Vermont 100
and Lake Placid Ironman? He did all of those in ONE WEEK. The man is a maniac
but he's also strategic and tactical. This episode covers his story
as well as his approaches to grit
endurance
and building empires.

Name: ExplicitEp 20: Dan Carlin - Hardcore History
Building Podcasts
Creativity
and More
Description: Dan Carlin is the host of my favorite podcast
Hardcore History.But... what?! History?! I know. I thought the same thing. How could a history podcast have a cult following?And yet it did. During research for launching The Tim Ferriss Show
I asked many of the top dogs on the iTunes charts: what is your favorite podcast? Almost without exception
the answer came back: Hardcore History.Since then
I've become friends with Dan (and more obsessed with his show)
and this episode explores all the questions I've been dying to ask him
whether related to his early experiments
his  radio  voice
creativity
building podcasts
and much more. I hope you enjoy it as much as I enjoyed doing it. Best
Tim
All data.Titles of Books Referenced in Show Notes: Dying Every Day: Seneca at the Court of Nero

Name: ExplicitEp 21: Mike Shinoda of Linkin Park -- On Music
Creativity
Selling 60+ Million Albums
Description: Mike Shinoda is best known as the rapper
principal songwriter
keyboardist
rhythm guitarist and one of the two vocalists of Linkin Park
which has sold more than 60 million albums worldwide and earned two Grammy Awards in the process.Mike has collaborated with everyone from Jay-Z to Depeche Mode
and he's also the lead rapper in his side project Fort Minor
which I'm a huge fan of. As if that's not enough
he's also provided artwork
production and mixing for all the projects that I just mentioned. The man is a beast... but did he start out that way? The answers might surprise you. This episode covers how he got started
advice for beginning musicians (or creatives/artists of any type)
navigating  entertainment  and Hollywood
daily rituals
how he writes songs
how he and his band rehearse
and much more.Enjoy! Tim
Episode Name: Episode 21: Mike Shinoda of Linkin Park – Making Art

Name: Ep 22: Ed Catmull
President of Pixar
on Steve Jobs
Stories
and Lessons Learned
Description: Ed Catmull is co-founder of Pixar Animation Studios (along with Steve Jobs and John Lasseter) and president of Pixar Animation and Disney Animation. Ed has received five Academy Awards
and -- as a computer scientist -- he has contributed to many important developments in computer graphics. He is the author of Creativity
Inc.
which Forbes has said  just might be the best business book ever written.  (!)This episode touches on a lot
including lessons learned from George Lucas and Steve Jobs
the origins of Pixar
personal challenges
routines
favorite books
and much more. Enjoy!
Titles of Books Referenced in Show Notes: Inc.: Overcoming the Unseen Forces That Stand in the Way of True Inspiration

which Forbes has said  just might be the best business book ever written.  (!)This episode touches on a lot
including lessons learned from George Lucas and Steve Jobs
the origins of Pixar
personal challenges
routines
favorite books
and much more. Enjoy!

Episodes.Name: Episode 1: Kevin Rose
Episodes.eDescription: I consider Kevin Rose one of the best "stock pickers" in the early startup game, and he can predict even non-tech trends with stunning accuracy. Kevin is a tech entrepreneur who co-founded Digg, Revision3 (sold to Discovery Channel), Pownce, and Milk (sold to Google). Since 2012, he is a venture partner at Google Ventures. He's also a hilarious dude, and this episode involves heavy drinking.
Episodes.eBooks: Venture Deals: Be Smarter Than Your Lawyer and Venture Capitalist

Episodes.Name: Episode 2: Joshua Waitzkin
Episodes.eDescription: Josh Waitzkin was the basis for the book and movie "Searching for Bobby Fischer." Considered a chess prodigy, he has learning strategies that can be applied to anything, including his other loves of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu (he's a black belt under Marcelo Garcia) and Tai Chi Push Hands (he's a world champion). Now, he spends his time coaching the world's top performers, whether Mark Messier, Cal Ripken Jr., or hedgefund managers. This episode is DEEP in the best way possible. And for a change from Episode 1, I'm totally sober.
eBooks: The Art of Learning: An Inner Journey to Optimal Performance
Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance

Episodes.Name: Episode 4: Ryan Holiday
Episodes.eDescription: This episode features Ryan Holiday, who became Director of Marketing at American Apparel at age 21 (!).Since dropping out of college at 19 to apprentice under the strategist Robert Greene, Ryan has advised many bestselling authors (including yours truly) and multi-platinum musicians. He is master of the media, and he knows how to both build massive buzz and respond to unexpected crises. I hired him to help with the launches of The 4-Hour Body and The 4-Hour Chef, and his unorthodox approaches always impress. He takes the paths less traveled.In this episode, we discuss dozens of topics, including the real-world strategies he uses to thrive (not just survive) when the world is exploding around him.Enjoy!
Episodes.eEpisode: The Tim Ferriss Podcast, Episode 4: Ryan Holiday

Ulysses S. Grant: Triumph Over Adversity

Episodes.Name: Episode 5: Jason Silva
eDescription: Jason Silva (@JasonSilva) is a filmmaker and has been called the  Timothy Leary of the viral video age" by The Atlantic. He is also host of Brain Games on National Geographic Channel. The show set a record as the highest-rated series launch in Nat Geo's history, with an average of 1.5 million viewers for the first two episodes.In this episode, we discuss his career, his skills, TV, what it means to be a "performance philosopher
Episodes.eEpisode: The Tim Ferriss Podcast, Episode 5: Filmmaker Jason Silva

Episodes.Name: Episode 7: Stephen Dubner, co-author of Freakonomics
eDescription: Stephen J. Dubner is an award-winning author, journalist, and radio and TV personality. He is best-known for writing, along with the economist Steven D. Levitt, Freakonomics (2005), SuperFreakonomics (2009), and Think Like a Freak (2014), which have sold more than 5 million copies in 35 languages.In this podcast, we discuss dozens of topics, including: his writing process, religion, how to  think like freak
parenting, favorite documentaries, and much, much more.Show notes and more at http://www.fourhourblog.com Just search  Dubner"Enjoy!"
Episodes.eEpisode: The Tim Ferriss Show, Episode 7: Stephen Dubner, Co-Author of Freakonomics
eBooks: Think Like a Freak: The Authors of Freakonomics Offer to Retrain Your Brain

Episodes.Name: Episode 8: Chase Jarvis, Master Photographer
Episodes.eDescription: Chase Jarvis is a master photographer and the CEO of CreativeLIVE.com. He is the youngest person ever to be named a Hasselblad Master, Nikon Master, and ASMP Master.Since opening his own studio, Chase has photographed for Nike, Apple, Columbia Sportswear, REI, Honda, Subaru, Polaroid, Lady Gaga, Red Bull, and many more. He is known for a hyper-kinetic style and an emphasis on sports, lifestyle, and portraiture. CreativeLIVE.com, of which he's CEO, is an online learning platform that broadcasts live, high-definition classes to more than 2M students in 200 countries. All classes are free to watch while live and can be purchased for repeated viewing. They are amazing. Teachers include Pulitzer Prize winners, business luminaries, and beyond.In this conversation, we explore his personal story, the most important choices he's made, common mistakes of "creative" professionals (or people in general), and how he reached the pinnacle of his industry. His lessons learned can be applied almost anywhere.For full show notes, please visit www.fourhourblog.com. Say hello to Chase on Twitter at @chasejarvis. Enjoy!
Episodes.eEpisode: The Tim Ferriss Show, Episode 8: Chase Jarvis, Master Photographer

Episodes.Name: Ep. 10: Brian Koppelman, co-writer/producer of Rounders, Ocean's Thirteen, The Illusionist, etc.
Episodes.eDescription: Brian Koppelman is a screenwriter, novelist, director, and producer. He is best known as the co-writer of Ocean's Thirteen and Rounders, as well as a producer of The Illusionist and The Lucky Ones. He has directed films including Solitary Man (Michael Douglas).In his episode, we discuss how he got started, how he handles rejection, his big breaks, his creative process, and much, much more.Show notes and links at http://www.fourhourblog.com Just search "Koppelman"Brian can be found on Twitter at @briankoppelman. Enjoy!- Tim
Episodes.eEpisode: The Tim Ferriss Show, Episode 10: Brian Koppelman, Co-writer/Producer of Rounders, The Illusionist, Ocean’s Thirteen
eBooks: The Artist's Way Morning Pages Journal: A Companion Volume to the Artist's Way

Episodes.Name: Ep. 12: Dr. Rhonda Patrick on Life Extension, Performance, and More
eDescription: My guest this episode is Rhonda Perciavalle Patrick, Ph.D., who works with Dr. Bruce Ames, the 23rd most-cited scientist across ALL fields between 1973 and 1984 (!).Dr. Patrick also conducts clinical trials, performed aging research at Salk Institute for Biological Studies, and did graduate research at St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital, where she focused on cancer, mitochondrial metabolism, and apoptosis. Whether you want to extend life, buy a stem-cell  insurance policy
or guard against cancer and premature death, she will have a surprise insight for you.Find her on Twitter at @foundmyfitness.Enjoy!Tim
Episodes.eEpisode: The Tim Ferriss Show, Episode 12: Dr. Rhonda Patrick on Life Extension, Performance, and Much More

Episodes.Name: Ep. 14: Sam Harris, PhD - Spirituality, Neuroscience, Meditation, and More
Episodes.eDescription: Sam Harris is a neuroscience Ph.D. and the author of the bestselling books, The End of Faith, The Moral Landscape, Free Will, and Lying. The End of Faith won the 2005 PEN Award for Nonfiction.In this episode, we explore the science of lying, "spirituality" or spiritual experiences, religion, meditation, and more. It's really a discussion of the human experience, and how to optimize it without harming others.Sam's writing has been published in more than 15 languages. Mr. Harris and his work have been discussed in The New York Times, Time, Scientific American, Nature, Newsweek, Rolling Stone, and many other journals. Show notes and links can be found at www.fourhourworkweek.com/podcast Enjoy!
Episodes.eEpisode: The Tim Ferriss Show, Episode 14: Sam Harris, PhD on Spirituality, Neuroscience, Meditation, and More
eBooks: The Experience of Insight: A Simple and Direct Guide to Buddhist Meditation
Waking Up: A Guide to Spirituality Without Religion

Episodes.Name: Ep. 15: Neil Strauss - Author of The Game and 7 New York Times Bestsellers
Episodes.eDescription: Neil Strauss has written 7 New York Times bestsellers, including The Game. He's also been an editor at Rolling Stone and a staff writer for The New York Times.In this episode, we discuss life, his creative process, writing, and generally answer the questions: How do you create amazing work? How to you overcome writer's block and other pitfalls? What are Neil's favorite books and movies? How do you edit your work to go from terrible to award-winning? How did Neil become a master interviewer, and how does he do it? What's next? Show notes and links can be found at www.fourhourworkweek.com/podcast. Neil is a close friend, and this is one of my favorite conversations we've had together. Enjoy!
Episodes.eEpisode: The Tim Ferriss Podcast, Ep 15: Neil Strauss, Author of The Game
eBooks: Emergency: This Book Will Save Your Life
Everyone Loves You When You’re Dead: Journeys into Fame and Madness
The Art of Nonfiction: A Guide for Writers and Readers
The Dirt: Confessions of the World’s Most Notorious Rock Band
The Game: Penetrating the Secret Society of Pickup Artists

Episodes.Name: Ep. 16 - Joe De Sena on Grit, Endurance, and Building Empires
Episodes.eDescription: Joe De Sena is the co-founder of The Death Race, Spartan Race (1M+ competitors), and more. Among other things, he has personally completed the famously grueling Iditarod dogsledding race...by FOOT. What about the Badwater Ultramarathon, Vermont 100, and Lake Placid Ironman? He did all of those in ONE WEEK. The man is a maniac, but he's also strategic and tactical. This episode covers his story, as well as his approaches to grit, endurance, and building empires.

Episodes.eDescription: James Altucher is an American hedge fund manager, entrepreneur, and bestselling author. He has founded or cofounded more than 20 companies, including Reset Inc. and StockPickr. 17 have failed, 3 have made up all the difference. He has published 11 books.Join us in this meandering conversation about just about everything. There are some gems to be found.Enjoy!Tim

Episodes.Name: Ep 20: Dan Carlin - Hardcore History, Building Podcasts, Creativity, and More
Episodes.eDescription: Dan Carlin is the host of my favorite podcast, Hardcore History.But... what?! History?! I know. I thought the same thing. How could a history podcast have a cult following?And yet it did. During research for launching The Tim Ferriss Show, I asked many of the top dogs on the iTunes charts: what is your favorite podcast? Almost without exception, the answer came back: Hardcore History.Since then, I've become friends with Dan (and more obsessed with his show), and this episode explores all the questions I've been dying to ask him, whether related to his early experiments, his "radio" voice, creativity, building podcasts, and much more. I hope you enjoy it as much as I enjoyed doing it. Best,Tim

Episodes.Name: Ep 21: Mike Shinoda of Linkin Park -- On Music, Creativity, Selling 60+ Million Albums
Episodes.eDescription: Mike Shinoda is best known as the rapper, principal songwriter, keyboardist, rhythm guitarist and one of the two vocalists of Linkin Park, which has sold more than 60 million albums worldwide and earned two Grammy Awards in the process.Mike has collaborated with everyone from Jay-Z to Depeche Mode, and he's also the lead rapper in his side project Fort Minor, which I'm a huge fan of. As if that's not enough, he's also provided artwork, production and mixing for all the projects that I just mentioned. The man is a beast... but did he start out that way? The answers might surprise you. This episode covers how he got started, advice for beginning musicians (or creatives/artists of any type), navigating "entertainment" and Hollywood, daily rituals, how he writes songs, how he and his band rehearse, and much more.Enjoy! Tim

Episodes.Name: Ep 22: Ed Catmull, President of Pixar, on Steve Jobs, Stories, and Lessons Learned
Episodes.eDescription: Ed Catmull is co-founder of Pixar Animation Studios (along with Steve Jobs and John Lasseter) and president of Pixar Animation and Disney Animation. Ed has received five Academy Awards, and -- as a computer scientist -- he has contributed to many important developments in computer graphics. He is the author of Creativity, Inc., which Forbes has said "just might be the best business book ever written." (!)This episode touches on a lot, including lessons learned from George Lucas and Steve Jobs, the origins of Pixar, personal challenges, routines, favorite books, and much more. Enjoy!
